Question for people who watch movies on their PS3: How are you dealing with the recent .mkv popularity in the torrent world? I liked it when we had BR rips in mp4 format cause it was always easy to just put it on a flash drive and view it on PS3.
@expometty use PS3 Media Server. Google it.

@expometty: I used PS3 Media Server but the transfer was just too slow. I now use an external HDD (Fat32) and convert convert the mkv files with Rebox.Net. Don't forget to set the option to split at 4gig.

Thanks guys, I'll give PS3 Media Server a try since I had already considered the conversion solution and found it too time consuming + it downgrades the .mkv A/V quality for some reason when it converts to .mp4 although I'm sure the problem is some complicated settings I'm supposed to pay attention to but won't.
@expometty: try using GOTSent it's a fast mkv to mp4 converter. It takes me less then 10 mins to convert a movie, give it a chance you might like it

just use mkv2vob it works perfectly for converting mkv to vob it just the sound not the video pretty much

@expometty Use txmuxer to convert mkv to m2ts.  PS3 can read those directly and you lose nothing in the conversion.   I have burned some to DVD or copied to PS3 hard drive as m2ts and play right in the PS3.

Full on Cinavia Protected. Too bad... great quality.

** NOTE: Cinavia Protected - EASY to get around. 1) Don't play it on a internet connected device
2) Convert it to a different format
3) Copy it to a thumb drive and plug it into your TV

If you play it in a connected device - about 15 minutes in the sound will drop out and a window will pop up telling you you're screwed!
